DataElement.preferredName: Heart Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Increase Function Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to a increase in the function of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction._the indicator relating to the results of an assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Heart Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Increase Function
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a increase in the function of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):Function; what something is used for.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ValueDomain.origin: AMC CRF:AIDS Malignancy Consortium Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has the patient had a left ve
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a left ventricular ejection fraction in the past 6 months that is documented to be 50% or greater

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, has the patient had an echocardiogram assessment and is the LVEF less than 50%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than 50% (measured by echocardiogram or MUGA[multi-gated acquisition] scan)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) greater than or equal to lower limit of normal by ECHO or MUGA?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a normal ejection fraction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is LVEF greater than or equal to institutional LLN as determined by gated cardiac radionucleotide scan (MUGA) or echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If cardiac function assessment is clinically indicated or performed: is left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than normal per institutional guidelines, or less than 55%, if the threshold for normal is not otherwise specified by institutional guidelines?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience cardiac dysfunction, defined as an ejection fraction (EF) of less than 50% during this visit day?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient experience cardiac dysfunction, defined as an ejection fraction (EF) of less than 50% during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient had an echocardiography or MUGA that demonstrated Cardiac ejection fraction of 50% or greater.
